editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Image 2r-3r: Order of the Church, ሥርዓተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን።, incomplete at the beginning. Illuminations painted recently over the top of text. Images 3r-xxx: Missal, Mäṣǝḥafä Qǝddase, መጽሐፈ፡ ቅዳሴ፡, see MQ, መጽሐፈ፡ ቅዳሴ። በግዕዝና፡ በአማርኛ። = Mäṣḥäfä Qəddase. Bä-Gə‘əzənna bä-Amarəñña (Addis Ababa: Täsfa, 1951 E.C.); Liturgy. For the pertinent references and comments, see HSEA. EMIP 27. Images 3r-56r: Ordinary of the Mass, Śǝrǝ`atä Qǝdase. ሥርዓተ፡ ቅዳሴ፡. Images 6r-74l: Anaphora of the Apostles, Qǝdase Ḫawaryat. Images 74l-78l: Anaphora of Our Lord, Qǝdase Ǝgzi’ǝ. Images 78l-89r: Anaphora of Mary attributed to Cyriacus of Bǝhǝnsa, Qǝddase Maryam Gwäs’a. Images 90l-99l: Anaphora of John, Son of Thunder, Qǝdase Yoḥannəs Wäldä Nägwädǝgwad.Images 99l-107l: Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers, Qǝdase za-Śäläsǝtu Mǝ‘ǝt. Images 107l-116l: Anaphora of Athanasius, Qǝdase Atǝnatewos. Images 107l and passim gives the name of the owner, ገብረ ኢየሱስ. Images 116l-121l: Anaphora of Gregory, brother of Basil, Qǝdase Gorǝgorǝyos, ‘Ǝḫǝwä Baslǝyos. Images 121l-127r: Anaphora of Epiphanius, Qǝdase Epifanǝyos. Images 127r-132r: Anaphora of John Chrysostom, Qǝddase Yoḥannəs Afä Wärq, ቅዳሴ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈወርቅ፡. Images 132r-137r: Anaphora of Cyril of Alexandria, Qǝddase Qerǝlos, ቅዳሴ፡ ቄርሎስ፡. Images 137r-139l: Anaphora of Dioscorus, Qǝddase Diosǝqoros, ቅዳሴ፡ ዲዮስቆሮስ፡. Images 139l-144r: Anaphora of Jacob of Serugh, Qǝddase Ya’ǝkob Zä-Śǝrug, ቅዳሴ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘሥሩግ፡. Images 144r-147l: Anaphora of Gregory of Armenia, the Wonder Worker, ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ዘአርማንያ፡. Images 147l-154r: Anaphora of Basil of Caesarea, Qǝddase Baslǝyos, ቅዳሴ፡ ባስልዮስ፡. Image 154r: Note of ownership, This book belongs to [the church] እፋፍ ጊዮርጊስ [i.e., Giyorgis on the hill] by ቄስ ገብረ ኢየሱስ, and his wife, ወለተ ኪደን. A curse follows on anyone who removes the book from the church.

origin.origDate: 1840-1851 (Image 11r mentions "our King ዮሐንስ [III 1840-41 and 1845 and 1850-51]. Image 151r mentions ሊቀ ጳጳሳት አባ ጴጥሮስ, [of Egypt, VII 1810-1852]), as well as a (presumably regional) አባ ሉቃስ

revisionDesc.change: Created XML record from EMIP Collection Metadata.xsls
